docs.lead_paragraph: As major health care legislation advances in Congress, the provisions most likely to become law are those that are identical or nearly identical in both the House and Senate measures.
docs.abstract: Provisions pending in the House and Senate health care bills would permit children to remain on their parents' insurance policies well into their 20's.
docs.snippet: Provisions pending in the House and Senate health care bills would permit children to remain on their parents' insurance policies well into their 20's.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Olympia J. Snowe of Maine was the only Republican lawmaker in Congress to vote "yes" on health care legislation, but will she support a plan that includes a government-run option?

headline.sub: Health Care Debate Continues on Capitol Hill

docs.snippet: Senator Olympia J. Snowe of Maine was the only Republican lawmaker in Congress to vote "yes" on health care legislation, but will she support a plan that includes a government-run option?

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated: On the Senate floor on Thursday morning, Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid slammed Republicans for slowing down, and in some cases, blocking the confirmation of nominees for various posts in the Obama administration.

headline.main: Senate Leader Blasts Holdup on Obama's Nominees

docs.abstract: Senator Harry Reid denounces the slow pace of reaching a consensus on some critical Obama nominees.
docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid denounces the slow pace of reaching a consensus on some critical Obama nominees.

docs.lead_paragraph: No sooner had House Democrats presented their health care legislation than the insurance industry gave it a thumbs-down.

headline.main: Insurers: Costs Would Skyrocket Under House Health Bill

docs.abstract: The insurance industry wasted no time lambasting health care legislation proposed on Thursday by House Democrats.
docs.snippet: The insurance industry wasted no time lambasting health care legislation proposed on Thursday by House Democrats.

headline.main: For Dingell, Vindication on Health Care

docs.abstract: The dean of House Democrats wielded his gavel at the crowd.
docs.snippet: The dean of House Democrats wielded his gavel at the crowd.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House speaker, Nancy Pelosi of California, on Thursday unveiled an $894 billion health care package that would provide insurance to up to 36 million people by broadly expanding Medicaid, the state-federal insurance program for the poor, and by offering subsidies to moderate-income Americans to buy insurance either from private carriers or a new government-run plan. Read the full post on the Prescriptions blog.
docs.abstract: The $894 billion legislation announced by the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, is similar in size and scope to a bill being developed in the Senate.
docs.snippet: The $894 billion legislation announced by the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, is similar in size and scope to a bill being developed in the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi should brace herself: her popularity in her home state is likely to drop today.

headline.main: Pelosi: Influence and Home State Popularity, Inversely Related?

docs.abstract: As U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi unveils a health care bill, she should prepare herself for her popularity numbers to drop in California.
docs.snippet: As U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi unveils a health care bill, she should prepare herself for her popularity numbers to drop in California.

headline.main: Pelosi Unveils House Health Care Bill

docs.abstract: The $894 billion health care package would provide insurance to up to 36 million people by broadly expanding Medicaid and by offering subsidies to moderate-income Americans to buy insurance.
docs.snippet: The $894 billion health care package would provide insurance to up to 36 million people by broadly expanding Medicaid and by offering subsidies to moderate-income Americans to buy insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: This year the health care debate has introduced tea parties, town halls and tele-town halls into the political lexicon. But today on Capitol Hill, House Democrats are putting on a no-frills rally for their freshly minted plan to overhaul the health care system.
docs.abstract: The House steps out with a rally on its health care bill.
docs.snippet: The House steps out with a rally on its health care bill.
